channel.title: How do i set my java paths?
channel.description:
Can anyone make me a noobie guide ? :)
i want to set my paths for compile :(

item.title: How do i set my java paths?
item.dc:creator: @Volencia Volencia
item.description:
@Volencia wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:5, topic:275742”][quote author=total annihilation link=topic=364229.msg2769364#msg2769364 date=1241031394]

I don’t feel like explaining

Come on, what was the purpose of saying that?
[/quote]

There wasn’t any purpose, however he’d expect people to explain for him.

I personally believe if you’re here asking for help, then at least give help back if you’re able to answer a persons question.[/quote]Agreed.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i set my java paths?
item.dc:creator: @Tommy_Brady Tommy Brady
item.description:
@Tommy_Brady wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:4, topic:275742”][quote author=minitus link=topic=364229.msg2769045#msg2769045 date=1241006254]
How do i set my environment variables ?

[/quote]

Right click “My Computer”, click properties. Hit the “Advanced” tab, then click the “Environment Variables” button.

Variable name: PATH Variable value: C:\WINDOWS\system32 [/quote]

Do you put that under User Variables or System Variables?

Read full topic

item.source: How do i set my java paths?

item.title: How do i set my java paths?
item.dc:creator: @yong_min yong min
item.description:
@yong_min wrote:

Program Files – Java

Find the version you have, such as “jdk1.6.0_13”. Right click on compile.bat, click edit and make sure it says:

set JAVA_HOME=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_13

Change the “jdk1.6.0_13” to the version you have.

Or set your environment variables.

Read full topic
